item.title: Conceptual Representations of Culturally-loaded Animals in Bilinguals
item.description: This project has been published on the Journal of Cultural Cognitive Science: Pan, X. & Jared, D. (2021). Cross-language activation of culture-specific features in Chinese-English bilinguals. item.title: The Impact of Cognitive Shifting and Intelligence on Creativity
item.description: This project has been published on the Journal of Creative Behavior: Pan, X., & Yu, H. (2016). Different effects of cognitive shifting and intelligence on creativity. Journal of Creative Behavior, 52(3), 212–225. and has been presented at the Canadian Society for Brain, Behaviour and Cognitive Science 2015 annual meeting, Ottawa, Canada.: Pan, X. (2015, June). The relationship between creativity and cognitive switching: Mediating effect of intelligence. Canadian Society for Brain, Behaviour and Cognitive Science, Ottawa, Canada.

item.title: Xuan Pan, Ph.D.
item.description: As a research scientist with 8+ years of experience in language-cognition interaction and bilingualism, I am experienced with examing human behaviours through carefully designed experiments. As a data analyst with 8+ years of experience with SPSS, R, and SQL, I am passionate about making sense of complex data and telling stories that helps people derive insight. As a newbie birder, WOW and OMG, why didn’t I notice there are so many lovely birds around me?

item.title: Xuan Pan, Ph.D.
item.description: Email: xuanpan1105@gmail.com Education Ph.D. Cognitive Psychology and Neuroscience 2019 University of Western Ontario, London, Ontario. 2014-2019. Thesis: The effects of linguistic labels on object categorization and perception. Investigated the impact of linguistic label structure on cognitive categorization and perception. Analyzed both behavioural (response times and accuracy) and neural (electroencephalogram brain waves) data with linear mixed effects modelling. M.Ed. Cognitive Psychology and Neuroscience 2014 Nanjing Normal University, Nanjing, China. 2011-2014 Thesis: The effects of cognitive switching on creative thinking (in Chinese, 转换能力在创造性思维中的作用).
